article.headline: Louisiana-Lafayette 65, Arkansas St. 59
article.story: JONESBORO, Ark. (AP) -- Despite going without a field goal for the final 5 1/2 minutes, Louisiana-Lafayette pulled off a 65-59 win over Arkansas State Saturday night. Arkansas State (9-17, 4-11 Sun Belt Conference) pulled within four points with under a minute left, but Louisiana-Lafayette's Travis Bureau made a pair of free throws to put the game away for the Ragin Cajuns (12-13, 8-6). Bureau finished the game with nine points. Kewain Gant led the Indians with 16 points. Shawn Morgan finished with a dozen points and 13 rebounds, seven of them on offense. Yima Chia-Kur and Ryan Wedel each added 11 points for Arkansas State. Louisiana-Lafayette, which led 33-27 at the half, opened the second half on a 14-2 run. Randell Daigle came off the bench to lead the Ragin Cajuns with 10 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
